{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3337345,"name":"","username":"cod9169","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/0ea827/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-19T18:03:24.325Z","cooked":"

Hello friends,
Our swerve module does not work correctly. In autonomous and teleoperated mode, the robot does not follow the Path correctly. The robot cannot walk in a straight line perfectly. I don’t know what to do to solve this problem. And it doesn’t seem to follow a pattern, sometimes it does the Path correctly, other times it doesn’t.
Attached is a picture of the behavior: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1rmgIB4HKg9sjxfBpSL23z428a0QNktNr/view?usp=drive_link

Hmmmm… Our robot has that same issue but in Teleop. Do you have that issue in Teleop if you drive in a straight line? If not, try making a command that sets the swerve speeds manually and check then , if it drifts, it’s probably mechanical or something is wrong with the encoder offsets on the swerves.

Yes, we have the same problem on teleop. In the video “IMG_3818.MOV” the robot is being guided in the teleop and this movement was a straight line attempt lol.

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1sDVzvEQzxFYlyAB3hk75gdGGXymSbXBF?usp=sharing

For the encoder offsets we follow this tutorial:

image1071×668 107 KB

","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T01:55:44.093Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":69,"readers_count":68,"score":13.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":459282,"topic_slug":"yagsl-swerve-mk4i-l3-not-follow-the-path","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/3/e/3eb7958ccabcde07f0ff2f9f3cd3e71c9ab475b9.png","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":63084,"username":"domidev","name":"Domenico","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/domidev/{size}/225499_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65222,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/yagsl-swerve-mk4i-l3-not-follow-the-path/459282/14","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3338070,"name":"Domenico","username":"domidev","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/domidev/{size}/225499_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T07:12:29.585Z","cooked":"

I would check on of two things: If the Gyroscope knows that the robot turned and that when you put the robot on its back and go in a straight line are all the swerves aligned? If so, it’s clearly mechanical and you have a problem with one of your modules that is causing it to drag and turn less. Maybe check if there is any resistance on any of the gears.

","post_number":15,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T07:12:29.585Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":62,"readers_count":61,"score":12.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":459282,"topic_slug":"yagsl-swerve-mk4i-l3-not-follow-the-path","display_username":"Domenico","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63084,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Lead Programmer @ 3990 in Montréal, Qc"},"post_url":"/t/yagsl-swerve-mk4i-l3-not-follow-the-path/459282/15","custom_user_title":"Lead Programmer @ 3990 in Montréal, Qc","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3338196,"name":"","username":"nstrike","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T13:19:35.940Z","cooked":"

This is a symptom of almost everything you can think of,

  • Robot center of gravity is not even.
  • Module gears need lubricated.
  • Absolute encoder offset configurations are not cortect.
  • PIDs are not reacting well enough for either drive and/or azimuth/steer/angle motors
  • If magnetic absolute encoder is used the magnet may not be secured well enough.
  • Configuration mismatch for a swerve module
  • The maximum physical velocity of your robot is not set correctly.
  • The amperage limits are too low (related to maximum velocity being too high)
  • The conversion factors are not all the same.
  • The module locations are not correct.
  • The conversion factor is not correct.
  • Utilization of cosine compensation
  • Utilization of heading correction.
  • If using pathplanner, the PIDs may not be tuned well enough.
  • If using pathplanner the maximum module velocity is too high or too low.
  • if using pathplanner, your path isn’t straight
  • if using pathplanner, your path doesn’t define a preset pose under autonomous.
  • if using pathplanner, you do not reset odometry while following a path NOT an auto
  • if using open loop, modules are driving at different speeds

I will be adding and expanding on this list on docs.

I created a webpage for this.

yagsl.gitbook.io

Swerve Drive Drift | YAGSL

Drift can be caused by anything and everything in a swerve drive...

The first thing I would check is the steer offsets. If one or more of the wheels doesn’t actually point straight forward, you’ll get behavior like that.

","post_number":18,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T19:21:08.007Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":45,"readers_count":44,"score":9.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":459282,"topic_slug":"yagsl-swerve-mk4i-l3-not-follow-the-path","display_username":"Andy Gasser","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44380,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/yagsl-swerve-mk4i-l3-not-follow-the-path/459282/18","custom_user_title":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3342574,"name":"","username":"cod9169","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/0ea827/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-25T12:10:11.512Z","cooked":"

Hey guys!!
I’m very happy, we managed to find out what the problem was. I needed to enable swerveDrive.setHeadingCorrection and disable swerveDrive.setCosineCompensator, thank you all very much, especially to @nstrike , the webpage you created that made me discover the problem.

","post_number":19,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2024-03-25T12:10:11.512Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":32,"readers_count":31,"score":26.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":459282,"topic_slug":"yagsl-swerve-mk4i-l3-not-follow-the-path","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65222,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/yagsl-swerve-mk4i-l3-not-follow-the-path/459282/19","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3342576,"name":"","username":"cod9169","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/0ea827/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-25T12:11:21.808Z","cooked":"
